children.value: Used to display long lists. When the list is about to scroll to the bottom, the event will be triggered and more list items will be loaded.
Because the page scrolling cannot be monitored in the uniapp component, it is necessary to monitor the scrolling in the page and then send it to zebra-ui through uni.$emit.
The List component controls the loading status through the two variables
. When the component scrolls to the bottom, the
. At this time, you can initiate an asynchronous operation and update the data. After the data is updated, set
. If all the data has been loaded, just set

props.code:
<z-list
   id="list1"
   v-model:loading="list[0].loading"
   :finished="list[0].finished"
   finished-text="No more"
   @load="onLoadData(0)"
>
   <z-cell
     v-for="item in list[0].items"
     :key="item"
     :title="`Cell${item}`"
     value="content"
   />
</z-list>

<script lang="ts" setup>
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { onPageScroll } from '@dcloudio/uni-app'
const list = ref([
   {
     items: [] as string[],
     refreshing: false,
     loading: false,
     error: false,
     finished: false
   },
   {
     items: [] as string[],
     refreshing: false,
     loading: false,
     error: false,
     finished: false
   },
   {
     items: [] as string[],
     refreshing: false,
     loading: false,
     error: false,
     finished: false
   }
])

onPageScroll((event: any) => {
   // $emit name is z-list-${component id}
   uni.$emit(`z-list-list1`, event)
})

const onLoadData = (index: number) => {
   const currentList = list.value[index]
   currentList.loading = true

   setTimeout(() => {
     if (currentList.refreshing) {
       currentList.items = []
       currentList.refreshing = false
     }

     for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
       const text = currentList.items.length + 1
       currentList.items.push(text < 10 ? '0' + text : String(text))
     }

     currentList.loading = false
     currentList.refreshing = false
     if (index === 1 && currentList.items.length === 10 && !currentList.error) {
       currentList.error = true
     } else {
       currentList.error = false
     }

     if (currentList.items.length >= 40) {
       currentList.finished = true
     }
   }, 2000)
}
</script>

children.value: If the list data fails to load, set
to display an error prompt. After the user clicks on the error prompt, the load event will be retriggered.

props.code:
<z-list
   id="list2"
   v-model:loading="list[1].loading"
   v-model:error="list[1].error"
   :finished="list[1].finished"
   error-text="Request failed, click to reload"
   @load="onLoadData(1)"
>
   <z-cell
     v-for="item in list[1].items"
     :key="item"
     :title="`Cell${item}`"
     value="content"
   />
</z-list>

children.value: The List component can be used in conjunction with the
component to achieve the pull-down refresh effect.

props.code:
<z-pull-refresh
   id="refresh1"
   v-model="list[2].refreshing"
   @refresh="onRefresh(2)"
>
   <z-list
     id="list3"
     v-model:loading="list[2].loading"
     :finished="list[2].finished"
     finished-text="No more"
     @load="onLoadData(2)"
   >
     <z-cell
       v-for="item in list[2].items"
       :key="item"
       :title="`Cell${item}`"
       value="content"
     />
   </z-list>
</z-pull-refresh>

children.value: Whether it is in the loading state, the
event will not be triggered during the loading process
Whether the loading failed. After the loading fails, click the error prompt to re-trigger the
Whether the loading has been completed. The
event will no longer be triggered after the loading is completed
event is triggered when the distance between the scroll bar and the bottom is less than offset
Prompt text after loading is completed
Whether to perform scroll position check immediately during initialization
The direction in which scrolling triggers loading, the optional value is
Triggered when the distance between the scroll bar and the bottom is less than offset
Through ref, you can get the List instance and call the instance method.
Check the current scroll position. If it has scrolled to the bottom, the load event will be triggered
Customize the loading prompt at the bottom
Customized prompt copy after loading is completed
Customized prompt text after failed loading
